node.title: Djokovic: I'd skip French Open, Wimbledon rather than get vaccinated
node.description: Tennis superstar's stand on vaccinations led to his January deportation from Australia, where he lost his bid to defend his Australian Open title.

node.title: Preview: This week at Parliament
node.description: This week at Parliament is not strictly a member's week. So here's what will be happening.

node.title: Picton charity shop closes amid anti-vaccine mandate protest
node.description: A charity shop in Picton has closed due to the spread of Omicron and the increasing presence of anti-vaccination mandate protesters, who are not wearing masks, in the small town.

node.title: Zoi Sadowski-Synnott's parents praise her 'nerves of steel'
node.description: The parents of NZ snowboarder Zoi Sadowski-Synnott's have praised their daughter's "nerves of steel" after she won a second medal of the 2022 Winter Olympics - this time a silver in the Big Air… Audio

node.title: Truck crash closes SH1 north of Auckland for hours
node.description: A truck crash on State Highway 1, north of Auckland, has closed the road near the Dome Valley area since this morning.

node.title: Yarnbombers target K Rd, Potters Park for Pride-themed creations
node.description: Auckland's yarnbombers have been knitting up a storm for Pride Month, as a way to celebrate without cancellations. Audio

node.title: Marylands School abuses: Order's leader apologises
node.description: The head of the St John of God Catholic Order in Oceania has apologised to the survivors of historical abuse at Marylands School in Christchurch.

node.title: Challenging times for Tongan seasonal workers in Australia
node.description: The introduction of a minimum wage increase for Pacific seasonal workers in Australia, is being welcomed by both Australian and Pacific Island union leaders.

node.title: Tonga PM counts mental health 'cost' of disasters
node.description: Tonga's Prime Minister Hu'akavemeiliku Siaosi Sovaleni says rebuilding mental health after the recent volcanic eruption and tsunami is a challenge.

node.title: Tighter lending among factors slowing house price growth - REINZ
node.description: Tighter lending limits and changes to credit rules are resulting in slower house price growth, the Real Estate Institute says.

node.title: Trudeau vows to freeze protesters' bank accounts
node.description: The Canadian prime minister says police will be given "more tools" to imprison or fine demonstrators.

node.title: Infratil revises underlying profit guidance
node.description: The infrastructure investor says its portfolio is relatively well positioned to withstand the pressures of a high inflation environment and the ongoing pandemic.

node.title: Olympian Zoi Sadowski-Synnott's father says confidence high heading into Big Air final
node.description: Sadowski-Synnott became New Zealand's first Winter Olympian gold medallist last week after winning the slopestyle. Today, she's aiming for another gold in the Big Air. Audio

node.title: UN warns more international help needed in Tonga
node.description: The United Nations Pacific office is urging the international community to keep up the support to Tonga and help it build back stronger after the 15 January volcanic eruption and tsunami.

node.title: Americans urged to leave Belarus "immediately" as Russia tensions rise
node.description: The guidance comes after a U.S. official told CBS News that Russian units near Ukraine have moved into "attack positions."

node.title: Far North scrubfires suspected to have been arson
node.description: Fire and Emergency believes arson is behind two scrubfires in the Far North over the past fortnight.

node.title: Covid-19: 163 schools and early childhood centres have cases
node.description: More than 160 schools, kura, and early childhood centres are managing identified Covid-19 cases in students or staff.

node.title: Ardern to visit US in May for trade delegation
node.description: Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern's visit to the United States has been set down for May, when she will also be the main speaker at Harvard's opening.

node.title: No need for confusion over move to phase two - Wiles
node.description: Microbiologist Siouxie Wiles says the country's move to phase two tonight is not as complicated as it sounds. Audio

node.title: NZ exports to get greater access to Chinese market after FTA upgrade
node.description: New Zealand has ratified an upgrade to its 2008 free-trade agreement with China that will give exports greater access to the Chinese market.

node.title: Boat spills 150 litres of diesel after sinking in Taupō Marina
node.description: The vessel is believed to have sunk after the hull became filled up with rainwater.

node.title: Meteorologist receives surprise Valentine's Day marriage proposal on air
node.description: While accepting the proposal, she expressed her desire to have a Northern Lights proposal, and in some ways, this wish came true.

node.title: L.A. man charged with trying to open plane door in midair
node.description: The Washington-D.C. bound flight was forced to land in Kansas City after the passenger was subdued.

node.title: Omicron: High demand for Covid-19 testing in Auckland causing delays
node.description: Lengthy queues are being reported at Covid-19 testing centres in Auckland for the second day in a row.

node.title: Amy Schumer among hosting trio for Oscars ceremony - reports
node.description: Comic actors Amy Schumer, Regina Hall and Wanda Sykes will host this year's Academy Awards ceremony, Variety and other media outlets are reporting.

node.title: Covid-19: Daily community case numbers drop to 744 from Monday's record high
node.description: There are 744 new community cases of Covid-19 being reported in New Zealand today.

node.title: Thousands still without power in North Island after Cyclone Dovi
node.description: Powerco still has more than 5000 customers without power due to outages caused by Cyclone Dovi.

node.title: Booster shot deadline communication 'appalling' - Disability Support Network
node.description: The Disability Support Network says the Ministry of Health's failure to notify the sector of a booster deadline extension could have resulted in staff being unnecessarily suspended or dismissed today.

node.title: Covid-19: Parliament press gallery journalist returns negative test
node.description: A journalist at Parliament's Press Gallery, who had a positive rapid antigen test for Covid-19 yesterday, has tested negative in a full PCR test.

node.title: Traveller self-isolation rules allow bubbles, require direct travel to accommodation
node.description: Travellers to New Zealand will be able to self-isolate in a bubble with family or friends, and will be able to leave isolation in specific circumstances, the government says.
